pros: Flexible schedule, great pay, rewarding experience
cons: manditory double shifts if someone calls off and there's no incentive for doing so. Most of the cients are rejected by society because they are verbally, mentally and many times physically abusive, they are a danger to themselves and extremely challenging in public and you are forced to socialize the clients by your PC( supervisor) even when it is obvious its not a wise decision. PCs weaponize their position.

pros: If you have good client's your job is easy.
cons: If your relief calls off, you're stuck there. Frequently did 24+ hour shifts during bad weather.

review_title: No support, no lifelines, no care
pros: I like the clients. The co-workers can sometimes be okay, but they hire people who are completely uneducated, even highschool dropouts just to keep warm bodies.
cons: Horrible pay, only 12.50 after 4 years of service, no management structure, brow beating, ALWAYS blaming employees for everything. Be prepared to work endless 12-24 hour shifts.

review_title: Good Company that Cares About Its People
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Reading, PA
pros: Caring staff and leadership. Hard work, but everyone really cares and makes the job enjoyable.
cons: Job can be challenging at times.

pros: It is the easiest job you will ever have
cons: everything else sucks here they do not care about staff or consumer

pros: Paid training. Easy way to get a few paychecks and then LEAVE. A lot of hours available (because no one wants to work) beware
cons: Where do I start... NO RAISES you can work here for 10 years and still be at the same rate. Bonuses are a joke & when they actually do dish it out they rape you in taxes and distribute it unfairly. One year someone got $20? Really?! While the office members got THOUSANDS! Horrible benefits, ppl fight for PTO, maternity leave,etc. Consumers are very violent and the supervisors don't warn you because they are scared too and can't find ppl to work. When you get injured they try to fire you so they don't have to pay you. Staff relieving you from a shift isn't promised so an 8hr shift can easily turn into a 16 regardless of that fact that you have to get home. They don't care. The consumers are neglected poorly smh this company "covers" a lot especially when state comes it's ridiculous. Staff are like prostitutes ...I'll just leave it from here STAY AWAY!

job_title: Residential Specialist Sleep Staff in Lebanon, PA
pros: The consumers i work with are great so are a few of the employees others are nightmares
cons: They do NOT pay fairly I have the lowest paid position. I get paid such a low income because im supposedly allowed to sleep during my shift. Which is almost impossible unless your a dead sleeper! They pay me pennies compared to the other staff and when my position needs filled others can fill it making 3xs the ampunt i make and they sleep more then i do and do less during their shift!ITS NOT FAIR AT ALL! Which is why they cant keep my position filled been here a year and there has been half a dozen come and go from this position just at my house! Would be good for a homeless person to get back on their feet somewhere to sleep and make some pennies.

pros: Flexible schedule and an abundance of overtime
cons: High turnover rate, exceedingly disorganized, favoritism overrides work ethic and loyalty, employees are put in dangerous situations (many residents tend to be violent and mentally unstable) with no support or adequate training, Company policies are outdated, do not address serious problems with management structure and the influx of residents with psychological problems better handled by an asylum. Management is mostly promoted from within, and chosen based on popularity not education. Management tends to be unsophisticated and small minded.

pros: Good Training and Good First Step Towards Something Better.
cons: Completely Disorganized, Unfair Practices As Far As Raises And Opportunities Within The Company, Crude Behavior From Coworkers and Management, Blatant Shows Of Discrimination, Understaffed, No Support For Staff, Lack Of Protection For Staff, Unfair Treatment Of Consumers, Caught Up In Sticking To Their Protocols Despite Their Erroneous Nature And Lack Of Effectiveness, Unfair Pay And Strong Focus On Upper Management Making Money Instead Of Putting It To Good Use Where It Is Most Needed, As A Staff Member I Was Always Made To Feel Second Rate To My Superiors Who Tout Their Money And Station.

review_title: My experience at Supportive concepts is somewhat satisfying.
pros: The pay rate is much better than other organizations in the area. The work schedule is flexable and the consumers are great to work with.
cons: The benefits package can be better I have had other packages that were much better for the employees. The culture of the organization is very open the CEO is a person that is someone that staff of all levels can go to sometimes worry free.

pros: It was a job and it paid more than unemployment. Some of my coworkers were nice. Not much good about supportive concepts.
cons: This company did not care about its employees one bit. I got punched by a consumer and was threatened by the same one. A couple months later a supervisor tried to bully me into working with that consumer again. This place was great motivation to get back to college. If you are thinking about work here, don't
